intro: Hydrolea glabra var. spinosa, commonly known as the spiny hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features spiny stems and leaves, which contribute to its defensive adaptations. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
